GURPS.addActorModifiersToEffectModPopout: Add Actor Conditional Modifiers to Effect Modifiers Popout.
GURPS.addedShockAtNextTurnEffect: Added Shock effect on next turn.
GURPS.addReactionModsToEffectModPopout: Add Actor Reaction Modifiers to Effect Modifiers Popout.
GURPS.addResourceTrackerToEnd: Add Resource Tracker at the end
GURPS.addShockAtNextTurnEffect: Add Shock effect on next turn.
GURPS.applyOptionsToAll: These options apply to all damage
GURPS.autoAddTaggedModsToRoll: Automatically add tagged modifiers to the roll.
GURPS.cannotDragNonFoundryEqt: You cannot drag non-Foundry equipment to another character.
GURPS.cannotImportGCADirectly: We cannot import a GCA file directly. Please export the file using the 'export to Foundry VTT.gce' script.

chat.Anim:
Play a centered or moving animation.
parameters (for both) list: display a list of available animations wX: wait X seconds before displaying animation <filename pattern>: pattern can contain * Xx:Y: repeat animation X times (2x, 3x, etc.) with Y seconds delay between animations
parameters for centered animations: c: indicates a centered animation *X: scale animation by X @self: use self as center, instead of target The following options can be added after 'c' f: flip the animation on the x axis (left to right) m: move the centered animation to the target n: do not rotate moving centered animation X: degrees to rotate animation :Y,Z: offset animation (default 0.5,0.5)
examples of centered animations: /anim <pattern> c *0.5 3x 'centered, 1/2 scale, 3 times' /anim <pattern> cf *2 3x:4 'centered, flipped (left-right), 2x scale, 3 times with 4 second delay /anim <pattern> cm 'centered, move animation from self to target' /anim <pattern> cmn 'centered, move animation from self to target, do not rotate' /anim <pattern> cfm 'centered, flipped, move animation from self to target' /anim <pattern> c90 'centered, rotate 90 degrees' /anim <pattern> cf180 *.333 'centered, flipped, rotate 180 degrees, 1/3 scale' /anim <pattern> cm45 /anim <pattern> c:0,1 /anim <pattern> cf:0.5,1 /anim <pattern> cmn:0.9,1 *2
parameters for a moving animations: -X: shift left (0.0-1.0) towards the start of the animation +X: stretch right (0.0-infinity) towards the destination
examples of moving animations: /anim <pattern> -0.1 +0.1 2x 'moving animation, left shift 10%, right stretch 10%, 2 times'
chat.DR:
Modifiers the Actor Damage Resistance<hr>parameters:
<formula><locations>: use a formula (ie. +2, -2, *2 or /2) or a defined value (ie. 2, 100) and optionally the hit locations affected (ie. torso, arm, left leg, etc.)
reset: Reset DR to starting value<hr>examples:
/dr +1 (+1 to all hit locations)
/dr -2 torso,leg (-2 to torso and both legs)
/dr 20 (set DR 20 in all locations. Will sum Item bonuses after)
/dr !20 (force DR 20 in all locations. Will ignore Item bonuses)
/dr reset (reset to original values)
chat.Everyone:
Apply formula to FP or HP of all player characters or roll On-the-Fly formula locally against all player characters<hr>parameters:
fp <formula>
hp <formula>
 [OtF]: execute OtF (locally) for all player characters
fp reset: Reset FP back to starting values
hp reset: Reset HP back to starting values<hr>examples:
/ev fp +1
/ev hp -1
/ev fp +1d
/ev hp +1d-3!
/ev fp reset
/ev [‏PER]
chat.FpHp:
Apply formula to FP or HP of selected characters<hr>parameters:
<formula>
reset: Reset FP or HP back to starting value<hr>examples:
/fp +1
/hp -1
/fp +1d
/hp +1d-3!
/fp reset
chat.Help: /help chat-command OR ?chat-command: to see help for that command
chat.Light:
Set token's light level<hr>parameters:
none|off: turn off light
X: dim light radius
Y: bright light radius
Z: broadcast angle of light 
#RRGGBB: color of light
W: color intensity (0.0-1.0)
<anim>: animation pattern (torch, pulse, chroma, wave, fog, sunburst, dome, emanation, hexa, ghost, energy, roiling, hole
SPEED: speed of animation (1-10)
INT: intensity of animation (1-10)<hr>examples:
/li 6 2
/li 8 3 90
/li 6 2 #ff0000
/li 6 2 #ff1111 0.5
/li 6 2 torch
/li 8 4 90 #ff7777 0.5 pulse 5 5
https://foundryvtt.com/article/lighting/
chat.Maneuver: Set the following maneuvers on the current character.  You may use * to match Maneuver names, example: '/man All Out*Double'<hr>
chat.Qty:
Modify the QTY column of equipment<hr>parameters:
<formula>
<equipment>
o:<equipment>: only search 'other' list<hr>examples:
/qty +1 equipment
/qty -2 equipment
/qty =20 equipment
/qty +1 o:equipment
chat.Ra:
Roll Against (or Private Roll Against)<hr>parameters:
X: Skill level to roll against
Skillname-X: Roll against X, but display 'Skillname' instead of 'Default'
<hr>examples:
/ra 12
.ra 13
/pra 11
.pra 10
/ra Sneak-12
.ra Brawling-13
/pra Trap-11
.pra FastDraw-10
chat.Remote:
Execute an On-the-Fly formula remotely
parameters: [OtF]: On-the-Fly formula <player names>|blank: list of player names (or blank to send to all players)
examples: /rem [‏PER] Chris /rem [‏ST+2]
chat.Repeat:
Repeat the following /anim command with a delay of X seconds in between.<hr>examples:
/repeat /anim 1.2 heal*blue c
chat.Select:
Select token(s)<hr>parameters:
<character name (may use '*')>
@self: select the token of the current character
!:select across all scenes, not just current<hr>examples:
/select Bog
/select @self
/select Bog !
chat.Show:
Show various values from tokens in the scene<hr>parameters:
-a : sort alphabetically
-pc : only show PCs
-npc : only show NPCs
<Attributes (primary and secondary)>
<Skill names>
parry
block
will
fright
per
vision
hearing
taste
smell
move
speed<hr>examples:
/show -pc HP FP IQ
/show -a Stealth PER
/show per move speed
/show -npc vision hearing
chat.Sound:
Play a sound in the background<hr>parameters:
w: wait seconds before starting sound
v: volume
<full path filename><hr>examples:
/sound w2.5 /path/filename
/sound v0.6 /path/filename
/sound w3 v2 /path/filename
chat.Status:
Set token's effects status<hr>parameters:
toggle|t: toggle the status
on|+|set: turn on the status
off|-|unset: turn off the status
clear: remove all statuses
@self OR :tokenname
list: display all status names
{JSON data}: optional 'duration.combat' data<hr>examples:
/st on prone :Bog
/st - shock1 @self
/st list
chat.Tracker:
Modify the Resource Tracker<hr>command format:
/tr0-3
/tracker0-3
/resource0-3
/rt0-3
/tr(name)
/tracker(name)
/resource(name)
/rt(name)<hr>parameters:
<formula>
reset: reset Tracker to starting value<hr>examples:
/tr0 +1
/tr0 -2
/tracker1 =20
/tr(arrows) +1
/resource(rounds) reset
chat.Uses:
Modify the USES column of equipment<hr>parameters:
<formula>
<equipment>
o:<equipment>: only search 'other' list
reset: set USES to MAX_USES<hr>examples:
/uses +1 equipment
/uses -2 equipment
/uses =20 equipment
/uses +1 o:equipment
/uses reset equipment
chat.W:
Whisper to players or the owners of the selected tokens<hr>parameters:
<[player names]>
@: whisper to the owners of the selected tokens
<hr>examples:
/w [Chris] msg sent to Player Chris
/w @ msg sent to owners of selected tokens
chat.Wait:
Wait X milliseconds before executing the next chat command<hr>parameters:
X: the number of milliseconds to wait
<hr>examples:
/wait 500

{displayName} is

GURPS.effectHintBlind: -6 to hit if accustomed to being blind; Hearing -2 success lowers the to hit penalty to -4.
GURPS.effectsNotApplicableDefenses: Does not apply to Active Defenses or other defensive reactions.

GURPS.forbidCannotRollWithManeuver: You cannot do a {roll} with the maneuver: {maneuver}.

GURPS.forbidMaxAttacksReached: You already use all attacks this turn.
GURPS.forbidMaxBlocksReached: You reach the maximum available blocks on this round.

GURPS.importGCA5ImprovedBlock: This file was created with an older version of the GCA5 export which does not correctly calculate block for melee weapons.
GURPS.importGCA5ImprovedInventoryHandling: This file was created with an older version of the GCA5 export which does not handle inventory text well.
GURPS.importGCAAdvMods: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which concatenates Advantage modifiers into the Advantage name, which can create very long Advantage names (and affect the character sheet layout)
GURPS.importGCABadBlockForDB: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which incorrectly calculates Block value for items with DB (e.g. Shields).
GURPS.importGCAChildrenWeights: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which incorrectly calculated the weights for equipment that contain other equipment.
GURPS.importGCAConditionalModifiers: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export that does not export Conditional Modifiers
GURPS.importGCANoBodyPlan: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which does not contain the 'Body Plan' attribute. We will try to guess the Body Plan, but we may get it wrong.
GURPS.importGCANoHideFlag: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which ignored the 'hide' flag for ads/disads/quirks/perks.
GURPS.importGCANoInnateRangedAndParent: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which does not export Innate Ranged attacks and does not contain the 'Parent' Attribute for equipment. You may be missing ranged attacks or equipment may not appear in the correct container.
GURPS.importGCANoMeleeIfAlsoRanged: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which may not export a melee attack if it also exists in ranged attacks (e.g. Spears).
GURPS.importGCANoParent: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which does not contain the 'Parent' attributes for Ads/Disads, Skills or Spells.
GURPS.importGCANoSanitizedEquipmentPageRefs: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export that may incorrectly put ranged attacks in the melee list and does not sanitize equipment page refs.
GURPS.importGCANoSanitizeNotes: This file was created with an older version of the GCA Export which does not sanitize Notes or Ad/Disad names.
GURPS.importGCSNoMeleeRangedNotesForSameItem: This file was created with an older version of the GCS Export which does not export individual Melee and Ranged attack notes created by the same item.
GURPS.importGCSNoParent: This file was created with an older version of the GCS Export which does not contain the 'Parent' attributes. Items will not appear in their containers.
GURPS.importGCSNoSelfControl: This file was created with an older version of the GCS Export which does not contain the Self Control rolls for Disadvantages (ex: [CR: 9 Bad Temper]).
GURPS.importGCSNoUses: This file was created with an older version of the GCS Export which does not contain the 'Uses' column for Equipment.
GURPS.importNoCharacterFormat: Unable to detect the 'character' format. Most likely you are trying to import the 'npc' format.
GURPS.importNoJSONDetected: Cannot parse JSON. Your GCS file seems to be corrupted.
GURPS.importNoXMLDetected: No XML detected. Are you importing the correct XML file?
GURPS.importOldGCSFile: Your character was saved with an older version of GCS, which does not output some required attributes. Update GCS to at least version 4.36, open and save your character file, then try again.
GURPS.importSeeUsersGuide: Check the Users Guide for details on where to get the latest version.
GURPS.importSelectFileTitle: Select a file exported from GCS or GCA.
GURPS.importSheetHint: Importing data for {name} using {generator}. Please wait...
GURPS.importTooManyContainers: You have too many levels of containers. The Foundry import only supports up to 3 levels of sub-containers.
GURPS.invalidUserForDamageWarning: Only GMs are allowed to Apply Damage.
GURPS.itemBonusText: Enter On-the-Fly 'Bonus' Formulas (one per line) to modify values of attributes, skills, etc.
GURPS.itemModifiersText:
Enter Modifier Effect (one per line) using format: <#tag> [<#tag>...].
Examples: -1 to DX #DX #combat, +2 Per #resting, -1 to all DX-based rolls #disease #combat.
GURPS.modifier3d6ImageHint: Select the image to display in the Modifier Bucket for the 3d6 button.
GURPS.modifierAddRangeRulerHint: If checked, the system will automatically add the last measured Range modifier to the Modifier Bucket.
GURPS.modifierAppearBelow: They will appear in the Current Modifiers list below.
GURPS.modifierClickToAdd: Click on modifiers above and to the right to add to your next roll.
GURPS.modifierCoverCrouch: -2 to hit (Crouching or Kneeling, no cover)
GURPS.modifierCoverProneHeadDown: -7 to hit (Prone, some cover, head down)
GURPS.modifierCoverProneHeadUp: -5 to hit (Prone, some cover, head up)
GURPS.modifierD6ImageHint: Select the image to display in the Modifier Bucket for the 1d6 button.
GURPS.modifierPositionHint: Select the position of the Modifier Bucket.
GURPS.modifierPostureCrouchRanged: -2 to be hit with ranged combat (Crouching/Kneeling)
GURPS.modifierPostureProneMelee: -4 to hit with melee combat (Crawling/Lying Down)
GURPS.modifierPostureProneRanged: -2 to be hit with ranged combat (Sitting/Crawling/Lying Down)
GURPS.modifierRangeMHExtremeDesc: Rival difficult to even see; sniper range
GURPS.modifierRangeMHLongDesc: Opponent out of earshot; rifle range
GURPS.modifierRangeMHMediumDesc: Can only shout to foe; shotgun or SMG range
GURPS.modifierRangeMHShortDesc: Can talk to foe; pistol or muscle-powered missile range
GURPS.modifierSelectJournalsAside: Only 'standard' (HTML) journals are valid to view in the Modifier Bucket. E.g., PDFs cannot be displayed.
GURPS.modifierSelectJournalsHint: Select the Journal entries to display in the Modifier Bucket.
GURPS.modifierShowOnMouseOverHint: If checked, the Modifier window displays like a tooltip: when the mouse hovers over the Modifier Bucket. If this is turned off, you can bring up the Tooltip by Left Clicking on the Modifier Bucket. You must restart Foundry for this setting to take effect.
GURPS.modifierSizeDetail: Difference in Melee; Absolute in Ranged
GURPS.modifierSuffocate: Lost 1 FP per turn from suffocation.
GURPS.modifierTabAside: Use System Settings to define Journal Entries to display here.
GURPS.modifierUserEntered: Or you can enter a modifier
GURPS.modifierViewScaleHint: Use this to scale up or down the size of the Modifier Bucket.
GURPS.moreThanOneActorMatches: More than one Actor found matching
GURPS.moreThanOneTokenMatches: More than one Token found matching
GURPS.mustSelectSelfOrNameTokens: You must select tokens, use '{self}', or use ':<token-name>' to apply status effects.

GURPS.nameIsReeling: {name} is Reeling. Move and Dodge are halved. ([PDF:{pdfref}])
GURPS.nameIsTired: {name} is Tired. Move, Dodge, and ST are halved. ([PDF:{pdfref}])
GURPS.nameSuffersCripplingInjury: {name} suffers a crippling injury {classStart}([PDF:{pdfref}]){classEnd} to the location {location}.
GURPS.noOwnedTokenFound: You do not own any tokens in this scene.
GURPS.noOwnedTokens: Your character does not have any tokens. We require a token to set statuses
GURPS.noteBlank: This note was intentionally left blank.
GURPS.notInCombat: You can only set the Maneuver if the token is in combat
GURPS.noUserForDamageWarning: You cant apply damage to a target using damage for another user.
GURPS.noViableSkill: This character does not have a viable skill (effective level 3 or higher) that can be rolled
GURPS.otfMustBeACheck: The On-the-Fly formula must be some kind of check
GURPS.ownMoreThanOneToken: You own more than one token in this scene. You can either select one and retry this command without the '@self' keyword, or use the ':name' option.
GURPS.pickLightSource: Pick the light source the selected token is holding.
GURPS.quickRollShowMarked: Show Selected Skills and Spells from Character Sheet
GURPS.removeShockAtNextTurnEffect: Remove Shock effect on next round.
GURPS.removeShockEffect: Remove Shock effect on next round.
GURPS.resolveDamageRollPrompt: What do you want to do with this Damage roll?
GURPS.resourceInvalidAlias:
Invalid alias [{alias}].
Only alphabet and number characters, plus ('+', '_', and '-'), are allowed.
GURPS.resourceTemplateClickToAdd: Click the '+' button to add a template.
GURPS.resourceTemplateHint: Use this to create, reuse, and automatically apply Resource Trackers to character sheets.
GURPS.rollTotalHits:
Total possible hits ({link})
due to RoF ({rof}) & Rcl ({rcl}) is {rofrcl}.
GURPS.selectTargetForDamageWarning: You need to select a token to apply damage.
GURPS.settingCheckConditionalModifiers: Check Conditional Modifiers in Actor Sheet
GURPS.settingDefaultADDAction: Set default action for Damage Dialog
GURPS.settingDragOnTokenDamage: On drag, apply damage to selected token
GURPS.settingGlobalItems: Actor: Display Foundry Global Item Flag
GURPS.settingHintActiveEffects: Allow the GM to create and apply Active Effects
GURPS.settingHintAddCumulativeParryPenalties: If checked, system will automatically add cumulative parry penalties to the roll for the tokens selected for Max Actions Check.
GURPS.settingHintAddShockAtTurn: When to add Shock effect on target.
GURPS.settingHintAllowAfterMaxActions: If checked, the system will allow the player to make an action after the max actions per round.
GURPS.settingHintAllowRollBasedOnManeuver: During combat, system will check the roll is valid, based on selected maneuver.
GURPS.settingHintAllowRollsBeforeCombatStart: If checked, the system will allow the player to make rolls before the combat starts.
GURPS.settingHintAllowTargetedRolls: If checked, the system will check if there is a target selected before making a roll.
GURPS.settingHintAnnounceCriticalRolls: If checked, the system will announce, with animation and sound, critical hits and misses. Only for players and non blind rolls. Need Sequencer installed.
GURPS.settingHintAutoAddTaggedModifiers: If checked, the system will automatically add tagged modifiers to the roll.
GURPS.settingHintAutoIgnoreQty: If checked, this will automatically set the 'Save current QTY/Count on import' flag on a peice of equipment when the user changes the QTY/Count (and it will display the little blue file icon). NOTE: This does not detect changes in 'Uses'. If you need to remember 'Uses' between imports, you will need to manually set the flag for that equipment.
GURPS.settingHintBasicPDFs: Select 'Combined' or 'Separate' and use the associated PDF codes when configuring PDFoundry. Note: If you select 'Separate', the Basic Set Campaigns PDF should open up to page 340 during the PDFoundry test.
GURPS.settingHintBlockImport: If checked, the 'Import' button will only be displayed on the character sheet if the player permission level is 'Trusted', 'Assistant' or 'GameMaster'
GURPS.settingHintCalculateEnc: If checked, the Encumbrance level will be set automatically based on the carried equipment (and you cannot change the Encumbrance level manually). If this is turned off, you can change the Encumbrance level by clicking on the new level.
GURPS.settingHintCheckConditionalModifiers: If checked, the system will look for Conditional Modifiers in the Actor Sheet and add them to Effect Modifiers Popout.
GURPS.settingHintCombatInitiative: This is the formula used by Foundry to determine turn order in combat. Warning: Only change this if you know what you are doing! We do not parse this for correctness. Set this field blank to reset the formula back to the GURPS Combat Turn Sequence, B362.
GURPS.settingHintConvertRanged: If checked, range fields in the form 'xN' or 'xN/xM' will be multiplied by the character's ST to determine the actual range for a thrown weapon. NOTE: This only occurs during import.
GURPS.settingHintDamagCondInjury: From Pyramid #3/120: Conditional Injury removes Hit Points from the game as the basis for wound tracking, and replaces them with an effects based method for injury.
GURPS.settingHintDamageAD: If checked, adjust the target's DR by the armor divisor on the attack.
GURPS.settingHintDamageBluntTrauma: If checked, use Blunt Trauma rules for calculating damage on flexible armor.
GURPS.settingHintDamageLocation: Set the default hit location used to apply damage.
GURPS.settingHintDamageLocationMods: If checked, modify Wounding Modifiers based on Hit Location.
GURPS.settingHintDamageMath: If checked, the 'SHOW THE MATH' section of the damage chat message will be expanded by default. If unchecked, you can click on the 'SHOW THE MATH' title to expand it. NOTE: If this is the last message in the chat log, it may expand below the bottom of the log, and you might need to scroll down to see it.
GURPS.settingHintDamageRestrictADD: If checked, only GMs can view/use the Apply Damage Dialog. Players who drag and drop damage will just receive a message.
GURPS.settingHintDamageSimpleADD: If checked, only display the 'Directly Apply' option in the Apply Damage Dialog.
GURPS.settingHintDragOnTokenDamage: If checked, dragging damage from the chat log to a token will apply the damage to the token. If unchecked, a dialog will show to ask for the target.
GURPS.settingHintefaultADDAction: When set to 'Target' it will choose 'Apply' for Player Characters and 'Apply Quietly' for NPCs.
GURPS.settingHintEnhancedInput: If checked, certain fields (such as FP) will display add and subtract shortcut buttons when they have focus.
GURPS.settingHintFlagItems: If checked, a small icon will appear after equipment (and features) created from Foundry Items
GURPS.settingHintFlagUserCreated: If checked, a small icon will appear after user created (not imported) equipment and before user created notes.
GURPS.settingHintGlobalItems: If checked, a small icon will appear after equipment (and features) dropped from Foundry Compendiums
GURPS.settingHintImportHPAndFP: NOTE: Current HP and FP are always read from the file during the initial import.
GURPS.settingHintImportIgnoreName: If checked, the system will ignore the 'name' attribute of the Actor during imports. This is useful if the name that you use in Foundry differs from GCA/GCS and you don't want it overwritten on every import.
GURPS.settingHintManeuverDetail: Determines what maneuver is visible to players other than the GM or Owner, if any. 'Full Detail': E.g., show "All-out Attack (Determined)" and "Feint" exactly as shown. 'No Feint': As 'Full Detail' except Feint shows as "Attack". 'General': As 'Full, No Feint' except option is not shown -- e.g., All-out Attack (Strong) shows as "All-out Attack". (GM and Owner always see Full Detail.)
GURPS.settingHintManeuverVisibility: Determines who can see a token's maneuver icon.
GURPS.settingHintModifyDicePlusAdds: If checked, the system will use the 'Modify Dice + Adds' optional rule, when you add bucket modifiers for damage rolls, as per B269.
GURPS.settingHintMookGenerator: Edit the initial values of the Mook Generator
GURPS.settingHintPDFOpenFirst: If checked, the system will open the first PDF found when multiple Page Refs are informed. If unchecked, system will open all PDFs founded.
GURPS.settingHintPlayerBlindRoll: If not checked, holding down the SHIFT key when you are making a roll will make a Self roll (only you can see it, no matter who you are). If checked, when players hold down the SHIFT key, it will make it a Blind Roll instead (GMs still get a Self roll).
GURPS.settingHintPlayerChatPrivate: If checked, most of the chat commands (e.g. /hp, /fp, /qty, etc.) will display as a whisper to the player (instead of an Out Of Character message). If you trust your players, and don't like to see the chat fill up with their chat commands, turn this on.
GURPS.settingHintQtyItems: If checked, a small icon will appear after equipment where the QTY/Count will be saved during imports
GURPS.settingHintRangeStrategy: Sets the formula to use to calculate range penalties.
GURPS.settingHintRemoveUnequipped: If checked, the names of the Melee and Ranged attacks will be compared to the carried equipment list, and if a name match is found, the attack will only be listed if the equipment is Equipped
GURPS.settingHintSheetDetail: Select the character sheet that you want as the 'Quick Sheet'. It will be displayed in the title bar, and the user can click between it and the 'Full (GCS)' sheet
GURPS.settingHintShowChatReeling: When checked, changes to any actor's Reeling or Tired status will be displayed as a chat message.
GURPS.settingHintShowConfirmationRoll: If checked, the system will display a dialog to confirm the roll before it is made.
GURPS.settingHintShowDebugInfo: For Document dialogs (Actors, Items, etc.), show the debug icon on the window title. When pressed it will display the document data in a dialog.
GURPS.settingHintShowDiceRoller: If checked, the system will display the dice roller shortcut to the right of the Modifier Bucket. You must reload for this change to take effect.
GURPS.settingHintShowItemImage: System will display Foundry Item's image in Actor's sheet for the selected traits.
GURPS.settingHintShowNavigation: If checked, a navigation footer will be displayed on the full GCS character sheet.
GURPS.settingHintShowReadMe: If checked, the system will display the 'Read Me' file every time a version change is detected.
GURPS.settingHintStatusReeling: If checked, Reeling (1/2 move/dodge) and Tired (1/2 move/dodge/ST) will automatically be turned on when the character drops below 1/3 HP and 1/3 FP.
GURPS.settingHintStatusWhisper: If checked, Status Effects messages (Shock, Major Wound, etc.) will be sent to the target's owner as a Whisper. Otherwise they will be sent as a Out of Character (OOC) message to everyone.
GURPS.settingHintTokenOverrideRefresh: If "on", try to draw tokens to properly fit the hex grid. Overrides Foundry drawing functionality -- turn this off if there's any odd Foundry drawing behavior. Requires reloading the world.
GURPS.settingHintUseEquipped: If checked, ONLY 'Equipped' items will be included in the weight calculation. If unchecked, all items in the Equipment list are included in the weight calculation. Uncheck, and the players can use the 'Equipped' flag to indicate they have dropped the item.
GURPS.settingHintUseFoundryItems: If checked, the system will create Foundry Items for player inventory, features, skills and spells when importing character sheets. When you import the character sheet from GCA/GCS for the first time, the system will create each item trying to preserve current player data info on actor sheet, including name, image, count, uses and notes. This can be a very long operation, especially for GCS sheets.
GURPS.settingHintUseMaxActions: Enable to let system check, for each selected token, if player is using more actions than allowed per turn. All Combatants = system will check only the tokens in combat tracker; All Tokens = system will check for all tokens in the scene.
GURPS.settingHintUsePhysicalDice: If enabled, TRUSTED players will be prompted for all die roll values. This allows players to roll physical dice and enter the results into Foundry.
GURPS.settingHintUseQuickRolls: When enabled, system will show a Quick Roll button in Combat Tracker.
GURPS.settingHintUseQuintessence: If enabled, adds the Quintessence attribute, and Quintessence Points become available to use as a Resource Tracker.
GURPS.settingHintUseTaggedModifiers: If checked, the system will automatically add tagged modifiers to the roll.
GURPS.settingImportBodyPlanIgnore: Ignore the import file's Body Plan.
GURPS.settingImportBodyPlanUseFile: Use the import file's Body Plan.
GURPS.settingImportExtendedValuesGCS: Import Extended Values from GCS Compendiums
GURPS.settingImportHintBodyPlan: NOTE: The Body Plan is always read from the file during the initial import.
GURPS.settingImportHintBrowserImporter: Check this if you are not hosting your Foundry instance locally (you are hosting externally, i.e. Forge). This import dialog can remember the location of your import file during the session (which means that if you import the character again, in the same session, it will not have to bring up the File dialog).
GURPS.settingImportHintEncoding: If you are importing a character and the unicode characters are not displaying correctly, change this setting to UTF-8 encoding.
GURPS.settingImportHintExtendedValuesGCS: If enabled, system will import the extended values for Cost and Weight when importing GCS Equipment Packs.
GURPS.settingImportHPAndFPIgnore: Ignore the import file's current HP and FP.
GURPS.settingImportHPAndFPUseFile: Use the import file's current HP and FP.
GURPS.settingNoEquipAllowedHint: Warning: You're trying to edit an equipment that is not linked to a Foundry item when settings 'Use Foundry Items for Equipment' is active. Please reimport the character sheet to recreate the Foundry item for this actor.
GURPS.settingNoItemAllowedHint: Warning: You're trying to edit an imported Item when settings 'Use Foundry Items for Equipment' is disabled. Please reimport the character sheet to recreate the Equipment for this actor.
GURPS.settingRemoveUnequipped: Actor: Remove Unequipped weapons from Melee and Ranged lists
GURPS.settingShowItemImage: Show Item Image in Character's sheet
GURPS.settingStatusReeling: Status Effects: Auto Reeling and Tired
GURPS.settingUseFoundryItems: Use Foundry Items for Player Data
GURPS.shockPenaltyNextTurnOnly: {name}: –{modifier} to DX and IQ for next turn only.

GURPS.slamDFRPGRules: Use the Dungeon Fantasy RPG rules
GURPS.slotNotUnique: There is already a tracker assigned to slot Tracker {value}.
GURPS.suffersHeadVitalsWound: {name} was struck in the {location} with a Shock penalty.
GURPS.taggedModifierTips: Add each tag separated by a comma. Use only letters, numbers and underscores. Ex.: patrol, disease, low_mana, etc.
GURPS.title: Title
GURPS.trackerNotUnique: Tracker name ({name}) or alias ({alias}) is not unique.
GURPS.userWantsToExecute:
Wants to execute {command} on {name},

Is that OK?
GURPS.useSettingsToSetDefaults: Use systems settings to set defaults
GURPS.warnMaxActionsReached: All actions used on this round.
GURPS.warnMaxBlocksReached: All blocks used on this round.
GURPS.youDoNotHavePermssion: You do not have permission to do that.
GURPS.youMustBeGMToExecute: You must be a GM to execute this command
GURPS.youMustHaveACharacterSelected: You must have a character selected
